intro: Bazina nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flowered bazina, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, often opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
